description.narrative: EthioChicken Group (EC or the Group) is the leading producer of day-old-chick (DOC) and poultry feed in Ethiopia, focusing on selling these poultry input products to rural farmers. IFCs funding will be used to implement part of the Groups 5-year program (the Project). Particularly, use of IFCs funds will be (i) capacity expansion that requires construction of two new breeding farms (60K bird capacity each) and one new hatchery facility; (ii) working capital for purchase of parent stock birds; and (iii) partial refinancing of an existing long-term loan.

Project level impact: (i) Benefits for rural consumers through better access to affordable poultry products in a market where access to protein and micronutrients is limited; (ii) Expansion in income opportunities for the poultry agents; and (iii) Improvement in skills and capacity building for female farmers to improve their sales and profitability (with the support of IFC's advisory work). Market level impact: Promotion of the inclusiveness of the formal poultry market by expanding the use of the appropriate breed and business model that is tailored to the needs of the Base of the Pyramid (BOP) farmers and consumers throughout Sub-Saharan Africa through demonstration and replication, potentially laying the foundation for the adoption of contract farming/outgrower models in the longer term.

name.narrative: As of FY20, the Group has eight breeding farms, four hatcheries, and two feedmill facilities across the main population and agricultural areas of Ethiopia. As part of the Project, the two new breeding farms will be built in SNNPR region and Amhara region, while the new hatchery will be built in SNNPR region.
